item.title: Realtor plays hide-and-seek, uses ASMR in viral listing videos
item.dc:creator: Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis, News4 senior producer for special projects
Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis, News4 senior producer for special projects

media:content.media:title: Local realtor uses ASMR on listing videos for social medaia
media:content.media:description: Realtor Lisa DuBois plays hide-and-seek during a video for a listing.

item.description:
A local realtor is creating a roar on social media with a whisper.

Lisa DuBois, a RE/MAX realtor in business for 20 years, uses her social media platforms to promote her listings. Recently, she found a creative and unique way to get more traction.

A few months ago, she decided that due to the heaviness of the world around us, her videos could use something fun, so she partnered with brand strategist Eric Cruz.

Cruz wanted to personalize DuBois’ social media videos. First, he asked her how seriously she took herself.

“Not at all,” DuBois replied.

Her answer led Cruz to suggest playing hide-and-seek in her listings. Now, they’ve become a viral sensation. One video already has over 13 million views.

DuBois showcases her properties with a now-signature style, playing hide-and-seek while using autonomous sensory meridian response (ASMR), as she whispers.

“I had to learn (ASMR),” she said. “That first meeting with Eric, he said, ‘OK, great. We’re gonna have some fun. Let’s do some ASMR.’ And I was like, ‘Sure, what is it?’ And he wanted me to tap my fingernails on the counter, but my fingernails are too short. So, he said, ‘OK. We’re gonna whisper.”

News4 couldn’t let DuBois leave without making our own hide-and-seek video at the station.

Partnering with Cruz helps DuBois’ videos pop, leading to great numbers.

“Usually, the hide-and-seek videos are like 10-20 minutes,” Cruz said. “It probably takes me that same amount of time to edit them. Sometimes, I’ll be like, Oh my God! This needs to come out, like, right now, and I’ll go out in my car for a second and edit real quick.”

DuBois said those views translate to clicks on her listings in D.C. and Virginia.

“A lot of follow-up calls from other agents going, ‘How many more leads? How many more sales?'” she said. “And none, yet. I’ve got a very, very solid real estate business. I did this for fun. This was to make myself laugh.”

Get the D.C. area’s top news and weather delivered to your inbox every morning. Sign up for First & 4Most, our free newsletter.

This story uses functionality that may not work in our app. Click here to open the story in your web browser.

item.title: The politics of real estate: How will the election affect DC-area housing?
item.dc:creator: Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis
Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis
item.excerpt: In January, when a new president and new lawmakers are sworn in, new White House staff and congressional aides will come with them. That means new prospective homebuyers — but with interest rates still above 6% and the rental market up a quarter, will we see more buying or renting?
item.description:

item.title: Look inside: NFL coach NaVorro Bowman's McLean mansion on market for $5.2M
item.dc:creator: Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis
Erika Gonzalez, News4 Anchor/Reporter and Patricia Fantis
item.excerpt: NFL linebackers coach and Prince George’s County native NaVorro Bowman is putting his mansion in McLean, Virginia, on the market. Take a look inside.

item.title: 3 Plumbing Warning Signs Every Homeowner Should Know
item.excerpt: Small problems are easy to ignore, but there are ways to recognize common plumbing issues before they turn disastrous.

item.title: Look inside Bradley Beal's former Bethesda mansion sold for $9.25M
item.dc:creator: Erika Gonzalez and Patricia Fantis
Erika Gonzalez and Patricia Fantis
item.excerpt: Bradley Beal, player for the Phoenix Suns and former shooting guard for the Washington Wizards, has sold his $10 million Bethesda mansion.
item.description:
